. 

There are several places called Washington in
, which is only a few miles away. The Washington on this page is most commonly referred to by residents as Long Valley.

content=local art gallery, international arts and crafts

content=very small museum open only a few hours a week, usually on weekends, call before you go to find out when they're open. Ask them to tell you the stories about George Washington visiting town.
address=East Springtown Road, Long Valley, NJ

content=Things To Do: Boating, Fishing, Hiking, Horseback Riding, Ice Skating, Sledding, Snowshoeing, Tented Events, X-Country Skiing, Picnicking, Baseball Diamond, Frisbee, General Summer Fun, No Camping though
content=At Patriots' Path. Bring your horses.

content=Historic antique shop. Local radio personality "Doc South" works there.
address=250 State Route 24, Schooleys Mountain, NJ 07870

content=Classic, historic General Store. Has changed owners, but it's been open since 1830. Fun place, all the amenities of a convenience store and deli, plus a small post office, in a very old, creaky building. If you're traveling a long distance just to come here, call first to make sure it's not closed for an emergency or something. Definitely worth a visit if you come to Long Valley.
address=9 West Mill Road - Long Valley
address=141 Schooleys Mountain Rd, Long Valley, NJ
directions=ross Streets: Between E Springtown Rd/W Springtown Rd and James Trl
content=typical bar, but friendlier - they have a seating section where my parents often took me as a kid - karaoke is available sometimes. Try the lobster bisque.
address=One Fairmount Road, Long Valley, NJ 07853
content=Very popular pub and restaurant that brews their own.
